itemDescription: British swimmer, Olympic athlete, British Empire Games gold medallist

wikipedia_page.main: Patrick Hume Kendall (8 March 1927 – 18 July 1968) was an English competitive swimmer.

link_mentions.page: Great Britain at the 1948 Summer Olympics
Swimming at the 1948 Summer Olympics – Men's 100 metre freestyle
response: | 26 ||align=left| Pat Kendall ||align=left|  || 1:02.1 ||colspan=2 data-sort-value=99.9| Did not advance ||

At the 1950 British Empire Games held in Auckland, New Zealand, Hale won a gold medal as a member of the England's winning team in the men's 3x100-yard medley relay, together with Pat Kendall and Roy Romain.  He also received a bronze medal with the third-place English team of Donald Bland, Pat Kendall and Ray Legg in the men's 4x220-yard freestyle relay.  Individually, he also competed in the preliminary heats of the 440-yard freestyle event. He won the 1947 and 1948 ASA National Championship 220 yards freestyle title,  the 1946, 1947 and 1948 ASA National Championship 440 yards freestyle titles  and the 220 yards butterfly title in 1954.
